meaningMnemonic: Alright, so it's not quite the same, but something that is <kanji>fresh</kanji> is also <vocabulary>vivid</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>splendid</vocabulary>. I know those are a couple things I'd associate with freshness. Try to make the connection here before moving on.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: This <vocabulary>vivid</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>splendid</vocabulary> fresh fish is MINE! You grab the <reading>other</reading> (あざ) one that's not as vivid and splendid. This one is mine.
